definition: ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: Chicken with rice, or beef noodles, sir?
sentences.chinese: 您要鸡肉饭还是牛肉面？

sentences.english: We all loved her – both for herself alone and for her spaghetti bolognese .
sentences.chinese: 我们都很喜欢她和她做的意大利牛肉面。

sentences.english: I'd like a large bowl of beef noodles.
We have Curried Chicken with Rice and Stewed Beef with Noodle.
sentences.chinese: 我们有咖喱鸡饭和红烧牛肉面。

sentences.english: I also like "stew beef noodle soup".
sentences.chinese: 我也喜欢吃“红烧牛肉面“。

sentences.english: The clarity of the beef broth is the way to check if the beef noodles are authentic.
sentences.chinese: 牛肉汤的清与浊是检验牛肉面是否正宗的秘籍之一。

sentences.english: I would like a medium bowl of potato and beef noodles.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一碗中碗的土豆牛肉面。

definition: noodles served with soy sauce/sesame butter etc
Sichuan noodles with a spicy and numbing sauce
knife-shaved noodles (pared or shaved into strips), a Shanxi specialty
hot spicy soup (often sold in street stalls)
lit. meat wedged in steamed bun/"Chinese burger"/sliced meat sandwich popular in north China
wonton/see also 餛飩|馄饨[hun2 tun5]
